intro: Anthorrhiza echinella, commonly known as the spiny root gentian, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a distinctive root system that is often spiny and adapted to its arid environment. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family, known for its showy, often blue or violet flowers. Anthorrhiza echinella is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
